oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Red Cross group starts campaign, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940). It cites that “A group from Division Four of the Commercial-Industrial committee of the Red Cross are shown above. Left to right, seated, are Charles L. Cornelius, Balie Gross and Ruben Seay; standing, E. W. Turnley, P. W. Thompson and L. B. Stevens. Members of the group not present in the picture are Thomas Herbert and John Witherspoon. The men are part of the 450 workers who began solicitations. Monday under the direction of W. T. terry. The regular Roll Call is from April 8 to 22, but the Commercial-Industrial Division began work early because of the great amount of territory they must cover. The Red Cross goal this year is $30,000 with 10,000 members.” Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: American Red Cross
